byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and GAIA PIANIGIANI

abstract: Italian Prime Min Silvio Berlusconi calls urgent cabinet meeting, day after German and French leaders urge Italy to quickly pass measures to help reduce pressure on the euro; meeting ends with no public decisions and no new efforts to spur the country's economic growth or cut its huge public debt.
snippet: Prodded by fellow European leaders for his inaction on Italy’s fiscal problems, the prime minister produced what appeared to be more inaction.
lead_paragraph: Prodded by fellow European leaders for his inaction on Italy’s fiscal problems, the prime minister produced what appeared to be more inaction.

headline.main: Pressed, Italy’s Cabinet Fails to Act on Debt Crisis
headline.print_headline: Pressed, Italy’s Cabinet Fails to Act on Debt Crisis
headline.seo: Italian Cabinet Meeting Called Under Pressure Yields Silence
